summary: In terrorists' hands, even small amounts of radioactive material could be used to make a dirty bomb. Over the past decade, we've made 18 recommendations to the Nuclear Regulatory Commission that would strengthen its security requirements for these materials. But more than half of those recommendations haven't been implemented. We now ask that Congress consider directing NRC to strengthen its requirements. This would include accounting...
title: Preventing a Dirty Bomb: Nuclear Regulatory Commission Has Not Taken Steps to Address Certain Radiological Security Risks
